description: Discover how surprisingly easy it is to make rich, smooth cream cheese at home with just a few simple ingredients like whole milk, vinegar, and salt.
instructions: 1. Heat the Milk: Grab a large saucepan and pour in your milk. Set it over medium heat. Stir occasionally until it reaches a gentle full boil. Reduce heat to very low. 2. Add Vinegar to Curdle: Slowly drizzle in the white vinegar while gently stirring the milk. Let it sit undisturbed for about 5 minutes. 3. Strain the Curds: Line a strainer with cheesecloth and pour the curdled milk mixture into it. Let it drain for about 10-15 minutes. 4. Blend Until Smooth: Transfer the drained curds to a food processor, add salt, and blend until smooth. 5. Chill Before Use: Spoon the cream cheese into an airtight container and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
notes: Don't skip stirring milk while heating to prevent skin and sticking. Be gentle when stirring in vinegar. Let the mixture rest for 5 minutes after adding vinegar for proper separation. Drain well but don't over-squeeze curds. Blend long enough in the food processor for a silky smooth texture.
